Comment: They travel to whatever reality gets them votes. Clearly it has worked. Dems, meanwhile, ridiculed poor, white voters for years instead of, ironically, being *inclusive*. Winning these big elections is about getting **enough** of them to come out ahead. The tired fallacy of "we don't have to appeal to ANY right-wing and centrist voters because there are enough Dems in the country to win if we can just convince them to vote," has been proven wrong many times. This is politics...I mean, it's literally the heart and soul of the discipline to appeal to as many voters as possible in order to win power! Apolitical voters vote based on the economy first, and maybe international relations as well. Activated political voters tend to vote based on wedge issues and are already committed to their party as if they were a sports team.
